en: You landed a great freelance gig that's going to pay really well. There's just one caveat - the client can't make up their mind about what they want!
You created a mockup they initially accepted, but now they want to go with a completely different idea. What should you do?
You grit your teeth and put in the extra work, checking to see if it's 'warmer or colder' at each stage. The client thanks you and you eventually get paid.
The client is upset. "Why hire you if you aren't willing to get the job done right?" They pay you for your time so far, but you lose the gig. Maybe a blessing.
